Posts.Content: Such good news. You must be sooo relieved.  x
Posts.Title: PLS HELP !!! BREAST CANCER WORRY

Posts.Content: Hi Nikki I didn’t know I had a lump either and was symptomless. The lump couldn’t be felt by the clinic when I went either. This is partly because it is very deep apparently. The lump is 10mn so quite small. Because it couldn’t be felt I had to have a localisation wire fitted prior to the lumpectomy. None of the procedures were too awful though. When do you get your results?
Posts.Title: I don’t understand why I’ve needed two needle biopsies and then a...

Posts.Content: Thank you Kacang. My team are absolutely amazing. I really can’t fault them. They’ve been kind and caring as well as diligent, which is great. To be honest I really just want to know what’s going on. I’m really positive about dealing with life generally but struggling with the wait.

Posts.Content: Good luck to you too. Xxx
Posts.Title: I don’t understand why I’ve needed two needle biopsies and then a...

Posts.Content: Hiya. I won’t say try not to worry because I know you will. What I can say is that reading through these posts has been a massive help to me.  There are so many positive strong women out there whose outcomes are great. Treatment is brilliant and staff I have seen are amazing. Let me know how today goes. Take care. X
Posts.Title: I don’t understand why I’ve needed two needle biopsies and then a...

Posts.Content: The courage shown by you and others is fab! The amount of advice and care through this forum is heartwarming. Big virtual hug to all x
Posts.Title: I don’t understand why I’ve needed two needle biopsies and then a...

Posts.Content: Results day today. I’ve been told it’s LCIS so no treatment needed. Has anyone had experience of this and whether or not you had tamoxifen?
Posts.Title: I don’t understand why I’ve needed two needle biopsies and then a...

Posts.Content: I was recalled from a mammogram in Nov then had another mammogram as a small mass had been spotted. I then had an ultra sound which ruled out a cyst and a needle biopsy. I was called back for another needle biopsy as they were’t ‘happy’ with the results. When I went for the results of that in Jan I was told it wasn’t the mass they were concerned about but the ‘active cells’ and the lump was an incidental finding. I needed to have a wide excision biopsy which I was booked in for and had done within a few days. Has anyone had the same experience. I’ve tried to be patient and do get my results in a few days but I am confused. How worried should I be?
Posts.Title: I don’t understand why I’ve needed two needle biopsies and then a...

Posts.Content: Thank you GRANNY59 It does feel really muddled at the moment. I’ve had the lump removed and the cells it contained were oestrogen potitive 8/8. No further surgery recommended. The nurses on here have been fab and are sending me some info about options. I guess that one of the difficult parts is not discussing it with family or friends because I don’t want to worry them. My children’s dad died just under a year ago so we are just trying to get back on track. Everyone on here is so lovely and reassuring even when their own journey is tough. Kez
Posts.Title: LCIS options for treatment

Posts.Content: Hi Maria and sorry to hear your news. Waiting is tough isn’t it. I’m beginning to realise that it is a lot to do with being able to make decisions and choices for myself. It’s good to be in that position (rather than just being told what to do)but really scary in case I make the wrong one. I know I’m in a luckier position than a lot of people do feel that I should give myself a sharp kick up the bum and get on with it!  I hope next week goes ok. Let me know. X
Posts.Title: LCIS options for treatment

Posts.Content: I’ve recently been given a diagnosis of LCIS. I had a lumpectomy due to a fibroadenoma so I know the whole area has been removed. I’ve been offered tamoxifen and yearly mammograms but am unsure what the best option is. I know with LCIS it isn’t malignant but that the risk of it developing a malignancy are a concern. My GP said he isn’t a fan of tamoxifen due to the side effects and also because it might not develop into anything. I’ve also got a friend who opted for a pdmx straight away because she wanted to eliminate the risk. I was just wondering if anyone out there had any experience of this situation. The information out there is so conflicting I just can’t decide what to do. Any help would be appreciated.
Posts.Title: LCIS options for treatment
